result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven C. Howard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Steven C. Howard is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Steven C. Howard was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:49 p.m. Defendant Steven C. Howard in court, in custody via video.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule. Calling 15cm458, 16tr1076, 16tr1224, 16tr880. Attorney Mary Burns appears on behalf of defendant. In 15cm458 - Attorney Burns states a sentencing date has been set for tomorrow afternoon for all cases. Court sets $5000 cash bond. Sowinski states that there has been no victim notification for tomorrow's hearing. Defendant statement that victim is incarcerated in county jail in Battle Creek, MI until July 8, 2016. Defendant statement to bond - requests lower cash bond. Sowinski statement to bond. All traffic cases to be scheduled for May 23, 2016.  Adj. 1:54 p.m.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
per Brandi - in ONSO _

3:12 p.m. Attorney Mary L. Roth Burns in court. Defendant does not appear. Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Burns statement off record of contact with defendant and defendant's family regarding today's date. State requests warrant. Based on non-appearance, Court authorizes warrant. Schiek statement to potential problems with victim notification. Adj. 3:14 p.m.
Sentencing hearing on May 11, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

2:30 p.m. Defendant Steven C. Howard in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court quashes warrant - authorized but not yet issued. Schiek statement that victim was not advised of today's date for sentencing - was scheduled as a voluntary appearance on warrant. Schiek requests adjourned sentencing hearing to contact advise victim of new date. Bail previously set is reinstated and is continued. Adj. 2:34 p.m.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Attorney Mary Margaret Hogan in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:37 p.m. Defendant Steven C. Howard in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm360, 15cm458 and 15cm513. State moves to dismiss Counts 2-4 in 15cm458 - Granted. State moves to dismiss 15cm513 and 15cm360 - Granted. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 1 in 15cm458.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 30, 2016 at 1:30 p.m. Bail continued. Adj. 3:45 p.m.

2:29 p.m. Defendant Steven C. Howard in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm360 and 15cm458. Hogan states that proposal has been made but no agreement reached - requests another date for pre-trial. Bail continued. Adj. 2:31 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

3:04 p.m. Defendant Steven C. Howard in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued.
Adj. 3:05 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
No face-to-face contact with T.J.E., telephone or electronic contact permitted for addressing mutual parental responsibilities.

1:18 p.m. Defendant Steven C. Howard in court, in custody, via video.  Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint to be provided, right to counsel - Defendant states he is represented by an attorney in underlying case - would like to seek counsel in this case - Michlig states he believes defendant is represented by Attorney Mary Hogan. Michlig/Howard statement to bail - Defendant states that no contact provision was lifted - State moves to dismiss Count 3 - Granted - Howard states he is staying 316 E. Timber Drive with his mother, child/girlfriend are staying at a motel - he is employed full-time at North States utilities - $15/hr pay - Court sets $500 cash  bond. Defendant requests $250 cash bond so he can pay for motel for daughter/girlfriend. Court changes cash bond to $250.00  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
